title: AirtelBuzz
author: AirtelBuzz
content: Gifted wife with bitcoin money on birthday and wife happily gifted handmade bitcoin logoAlmost every year I celebrate my wife's birthday. This year too I celebrated my wife's birthday but it felt different from previous birthdays for me and my wife too. My wife's birthday was on 20/12/2023. I was very busy these two days for which I could not do the post but I got time today so I did the post.This year I gifted my wife a hair straightener for her birthday with my invested bitcoins which cost not too much just $20. I have about $200 worth of invested bitcoins from which I spent about $85 on my wife's birthday gift and other stuff. But my wife is very happy to receive this gift from me because I gave her bitcoin money. I told my wife about bitcoin a long time ago she knows and understands well when it comes to bitcoin. He also said to invest in bitcoin with me but because he didn't have enough money he couldn't invest in bitcoin but I continue to invest in bitcoin sometimes buy some amount of bitcoin and try to hold for a long time maybe will continue in future.    My wife was happy to receive my bitcoin money gift and she gifted me bitcoin logo which I think is very beautiful because she made it with her own hands very hard just to gift me. Many may not like it. But after I gave him the gift, he stayed up all night and made me this handmade bitcoin logo as a reminder that I gave him a birthday gift in bitcoins.I want everyone's prayers for my family and lastly a big thanks to Satoshi who created bitcoin and bitcoin forum. Maybe if he didn't create bitcoin we wouldn't know about bitcoin or even invest in it.

comments.author: ZAINmalik75
comments.body: Quote from: AirtelBuzz on December 22, 2023, 04:44:32 PMMy wife was happy to receive my bitcoin money gift and she gifted me bitcoin logo which I think is very beautiful because she made it with her own hands very hard just to gift me. Many may not like it. But after I gave him the gift, he stayed up all night and made me this handmade bitcoin logo as a reminder that I gave him a birthday gift in bitcoins.I want everyone's prayers for my family and lastly a big thanks to Satoshi who created bitcoin and bitcoin forum. Maybe if he didn't create bitcoin we wouldn't know about bitcoin or even invest in it.First of all happy birthday to your wife and may you both live a long happy married life. I do not want to ruin your post or post something that will dishearten you but your post is very confusing, as I thought you gifted her BTC so she would know how it feels to invest in BTC or have some BTC in my own custody. But after reading your post twice, I realized you used your BTC worth around $200 and you used $85 out of it for all the gifts and other stuff like cakes or decoration items, etc. Which means you simply used your BTC earnings to celebrate your wife's HBD. I don't know if it is worth to be sharing or not, because I also use my BTC earnings to make my living, to gifts to my relatives, my parents, and my siblings, and even to meet the expenses of my house. I just made a deal with my father that I will manage the home rent, and you don't have to take care of it now. I did not create a topic on it, I think I should also make one. I am not trying to be hard, I can understand you wanted to thank the community and maybe those who are behind BTC because they are the main reason you celebrated this birthday or maybe you would achieve great things in future with BTC not only you but me, and every other member and person who have adopted BTC. It has changed lives of everyone.

comments.author: nakamura12
comments.body: It's not about what gift it is because what matters the most is the gesture of giving the gift. I don't like the gift but I like the thought of doing it just to give you something after receiving a gift from you on birthday and also the reason where you get the money which is from your investment. As I have said, I don't like the give but still would keep it if I were you because the effort of your wife to make it and the thought of giving you that as a thank you of celebrating her birthday. Once again, it's not the value of the gift but the thought of doing it and also thanking the community if that's what you mean.

comments.author: The Cryptovator
comments.body: I wish all the best to both of you. It's good you celebrated your wife's birthday with bitcoin earnings. I thought you gifted Bitcoin, but I clearly understood when I read the full post that you bought a gift with your earnings from Bitcoin. However, I feel a direct Bitcoin gift would be more memorable; I mean, gift some Bitcoin to her wallet. Since it's already past, you may plan for the next birthday. A bitcoin gift might give a good return in the near future as well, which would be special for both of you. Anyway, you did good and appreciate your wife's gift, which is BTC writing and logo.

comments.author: alastantiger
comments.body: Your wife is a very lucky woman. I have found that families that have interests in Bitcoin stay together. Their bond of love and romance thrives. Bitcoin has united more families. This is the side(indirect ) benefit of holding Bitcoin. If I received a gift like this from my wife, she can have whatever she wants for the rest of the year.

comments.author: BIT-BENDER
comments.body: Happy birthday to your wife, well my girlfriend would prefer I buy her a very good hand bag than I give her Bitcoin, Lolz, well regardless I prefer giving people a gift they value the most, I have seen many people forcing Bitcoin down the throat of their loved ones, in terms of giving gift always go for what the person would cherish and adore.I am a Bitcoin enthusiast but I would love my birthday gift in other things I would value and cherish.

comments.author: darkangel11
comments.body: I'm not hating, but you guys are funny. She gave you a piece of styrofoam with the word bitcoin on it! Just think about that. You give someone a gift and that person gives you back a piece of styrofoam with the name of that gift, like you decided to give your woman an iphone and the next day she gives you back a piece of wood with the word iphone written on it. I'd probably frame that and show it to friends when they come to visit saying it was the best gift I ever got from my wife

comments.author: SatoPrincess
comments.body: We shouldn’t put everything that we do in our personal on the net. Just because bitcoin is somehow related in a particular event doesn’t mean it’s worth creating a topic on bitcoin discussion about it. If you had not bought the gifts with your bitcoin hodlings (which I think isn’t the best, you could have used fiat to buy the gifts) would you have started this topic? I also don’t know understand why she gave you a btc logo gift.

comments.author: Bananington
comments.body: It is more of a thrill that our OP 's wife didn't frown or reject the BTC gift given to her, because if she had, no matter the good intentions at first, it would be meaningless to even talk about it. I think women love cash gifts or investment gifts more too, because it is one time where they have control over their finances mostly if they are dependent on the man to take of them and the household. Am also convinced you wouldn't have bought such a gift if you hadn't spent much time educating her on the subject of BTC or perhaps she is the one with the motivation and whip on your back to invest in BTC for the future benefits.

comments.author: Renampun
comments.body: Isn't it a little strange if you tell something like this to the public, sorry, have you run out of ideas to create a topic?Birthdays should be a happy occasion for both of you but just giving your wife a bitcoin logo I think is a bit ridiculous, you should give your wife bitcoin in a personal wallet lolI really hope that your relationship with your family continues to be good, as a fellow forum member, that's all I can say, always make my wife happy with the good achievements you get, especially investing in Bitcoin, continue to improve it.

comments.author: sheenshane
comments.body: People around and love us know what our likes and dislikes are, I often experienced this when I received a cake on my birthday with a Bitcoin logo or a birthday cake with a Bitcoin design because they know I value and love Bitcoin. The same as OP, because you know that your wife loved Bitcoin so much that's why she gifted you Bitcoin. I know how Bitcoin helped us regarding financial matters that's why we value it so much, I'm happy to hear your story that I experienced too.I hope you know will about Bitcoin and how to keep it in a secure place, next time, you can buy a hardware wallet where to keep your Bitcoin.

comments.author: Bushdark
comments.body: Happy birthday to her and it is so amazing giving your wife gift that she really appreciated with all her heart. Bitcoin has been a big treasure to many of us and if not for Bitcoin, we would have not been here discussing about the wonders of Bitcoin. I believe as you have gifted her what she really admire to have, she might gift you more than you would expect this season of love. Let's keep promoting and taking about Bitcoin so that those that had been pessimistic about Bitcoin would see reasons of investing.

comments.author: Japinat
comments.body: Happy birthday to your wife OP. It's a good thing that you actually both share the love for bitcoin. Bitcoin may be complicated at first, but when you come to understand it well, you will realize that bitcoin is very precious to hold. I hope you will grow your bitcoins together and for me that's very possible as long as you keep supporting each other most especially when it comes to finances that bitcoin is mostly concern about.However, since you gifted your wife with bitcoin, then you must teach her as well how to secure his bitcoin and hold it for long term. Bitcoin will likely to gain its huge potentials when it's safely hold for years in a secured wallet.

comments.author: PX-Z
comments.body: Happy birthday to your wife. The gift (bitcoin logo) is beautiful, its just needs a little improvements, maybe if you will give her more bitcoin (soon) it will improve drastically Looks like a simple house yet a happy family, that's what it make the best. Treasure your wife, your family and your bitcoin. Quote from: SatoPrincess on December 22, 2023, 09:31:46 PMI also don’t know understand why she gave you a btc logo gift. You will soon, if you have a loving husband/wife @OP best thing you can do after this is to educate her on how to secure bitcoin, basic things on how bitcoin works and what's the benefit of having bitcoin.

comments.author: lovesmayfamilis
comments.body: OP, you probably understand that when posting this topic, you will encounter a lot of criticism. I won't be unique if I say that the purpose of this thread is merit hunting. Let us all tell you where and what we use our bitcoins that we exchange for fiat. Are you really interested in this? Now that we are waiting for the New Year, maybe we will create a roll call of who gave what gifts to whom.But seriously, OP, if you are married, young, and your family decided to go with Bitcoin, teach your wife. Let her join the forum, read, and help you develop. Perhaps your young family will receive even more bonuses instead of drawings on foam plastic.Honestly, I see the forum as a big family. We cry together about the death of a grandmother unknown to us, and congratulate someone else’s wife.

comments.author: Ruttoshi
comments.body: 0P, you must be a loving and caring man n you wife is very lucky to have someone like you as her husband. You did well to celebrate her birthday for her with partof your bitcoin and she also showed you love back by reciprocating to give you a hand made bitcoin write up, because that is not bitcoin logo.Assuming you kept your bitcoin till next year and use it to celebrate a bigger birthday than this because by then bitcoin price might have hit $100k, and maybe she would have done something much better than only bitcoin write up. Don't sell your bitcoin anymore, try to hodli and have an emergency funds prepared to take care of any expenses that might arise.Happy belated birthday to your wife and a big congratulations to her.

comments.author: kryptqnick
comments.body: Judging from the post and some interpretations in the thread, you spent some BTC on buying a hair straightener, right? So you didn't literally give her BTC, you used some BTC to buy this thing?It's hard to read the post when a lot of times the op is saying "he" either when meaning "she" (wife) or when talking about himself... I also found it weird that you celebrate your wife's birthday "almost every year" because I thought every year makes more sense.In any case, I'm happy it worked out for both of you, with you using BTC to buy her a present, and her making a BTC logo.

comments.author: Latviand
comments.body: Quote from: AirtelBuzz on December 22, 2023, 04:44:32 PMMy wife was happy to receive my bitcoin money gift and she gifted me bitcoin logo which I think is very beautiful because she made it with her own hands very hard just to gift me. Many may not like it. But after I gave him the gift, he stayed up all night and made me this handmade bitcoin logo as a reminder that I gave him a birthday gift in bitcoins.Glad that you're enjoying the celebration besides the cliche part that your biggest gift is that you're together celebrating that special day, the fact that you've incorporated bitcoin in your celebration is one of a kind and I don't think there's no gift in the world that will top that when it comes to value because it's made with love. Don't say that negative bullshit that not many may not like it because I don't think it's true, sure there's some that are going to constructively criticize you but don't let it make you falter, and those that genuinely hate this display of celebration of bitcoin, they're just jealous that you've got a loving and supportive partner.
